comment.text:
FOOD: Made to order, I believe. I waited about 10-15 minutes for my order to be made. I got the original sandwich with fries. Fries were super crispy and hot. Sandwich was well cooked and hot as well. For fountain drinks they offer Coke products from a standard machine. 

SERVICE: Staff was kind and got my order out quickly. One thing I appreciate is how they asked me what options I want for my chicken (bbq, spicy, or sweet original) and actually said it instead of me expecting to know them. It's the little things that matter. 

AMBIANCE: Plenty of spots to sit at and I imagine it gets busy during peak hours on the weekend. There's a few outdoor seating spots but the area was being pressure washed when I came. There's booths, table tops, and regular tables. There's a modern feel to the store which is different than the one in Chamblee. 

OVERALL: I recommend and would definitely visit if I wanted something fast casual that wasn't CFA. For parking, I parked in the Publix lot and walked over.

My first time visiting and I liked it! Chicken sandwich was delicious and so were the sweet potato fries. Portion was big. The lady at the register was very nice and food came to our table fast.
I like the location and the interior and I liked that they have outdoor seating.
Would like to go back to try something else.

I've only ever ordered take out from Ponko but it has NEVER disappointed! Everything always tastes amazing and fresh and I can never get tired of their ponko sauce. I usually always get my order with a side of green beans and Cole slaw.

photos.caption: PONKO Chicken Plate with PONKO fries

comment.text:
If you had to know one thing about this place it's to GET THEIR BUTTERMILK RANCH 
Anyway, this is on the expensive side of food available in this area for a college student. But, if you get the plate it is certainly A LOT of food and a lot of delicious food! Their fries are so crispy and thin and well seasoned. Their fried chicken is honestly amazing and very well fried. But again what seals the deal is that their buttermilk ranch is honestly one of my favorite things in the whole world I could drink it straight. 
The place is nothing extraordinary or nothing bad it's cute and clean. They do have trivia and discounted tacos on Tuesdays if you're interested in that. 
The service is pretty quick unless you're in a really big group but it's never too long a wait.

Ponko Chicken is an absolute gem in the Atlanta area! The chicken is cooked to perfection - crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and bursting with flavor. The sides are equally impressive, offering a delightful complement to the main attraction. The overall experience was nothing short of delightful. If you're in Atlanta and have a hankering for delicious chicken, this is the spot to be!
Went based on Yelp reviews and wasn't disappointed. Great chicken. Ordered the spicy but it wasn't very spicy. Had the sweet fries and they were excellent.

I love the vibe at the Ponko Chicken in ATL! I'm a regular at the Pooler location and had to get a taste of the original location. I was not expecting a large bar area and live music - so cool! The staff was beyond friendly. My food came out quickly and tasted amazing. I love how crispy the tenders are. The rice was also sticky - huge bonus for that! Ponko, I love you. Please don't change a thing! 5 stars for food, service and ambiance!

I went to Ponko with a group of friends for a late dinner. The staff is amazing - they are nice, fun, and just happy. 

I got the Tofu Tender plate with French fries and the green beans. The green beans were delicious. I highly recommend the spicy tofu tenders. I got the matcha margarita and it was good. 

I can't wait to return and try the sandwich!

It's fine. I can't really say what's special about this place. There's so many fried chicken joints in Atlanta, this one might be a healthier option? I only say that because the chicken tastes bland. lol
Absolutely tf not.. service bs, food not real & nasty they didn't pass they health inspection

Ponko chicken is the one of my go to places for taco Tuesday. The chicken is delicious, crunchy and flavor and tender on the inside. The slaw on the tacos adds a nice texture and believe it or not these gourmet tacos are 2$ all day Tuesday!
My friend and I also tried brunch at ponko and we both had to agree that the eggs Benedict was superior to all other places in Atlanta. Highly highly impressive stuff guys! 
We were excited to try the brunch cocktails as well but was told they didn't have a bartender until later on the day. We will just have to come back, 5 stars through and through

I wanna start by saying the aesthetic of this restaurant is amazing! I have been to other Panko chicken restaurants and this by far is my favorite one for the aesthetic. I've never seen a Ponko restaurant with a bar area. But I guess it makes sense for this location. 

Now let's talk about the food. The chicken here is some of the best chicken I've ever had. Vey crispy and flavorful. On my trip to this location I decided to try the tacos. I wanted to try each of the flavors so I got one original, one spicy, and one bbq. Tacos are 3 for $10. I also got a side of sweet potato fries for $4. The prices are really reasonable. The customer service is great. I ordered sweet potato fries and they gave me regular fries let them know. They politely made me the correct thing it let me keep the other one. 

Would recommend this location!

photos.caption: PONKO Chicken Taco 1 original, 1 spicy and 1 bbq

comment.text: Came here for the first time ever tonight. I'd heard about the place and was intrigued, but I don't eat meat. My partner who is vegan found out they had vegan options now, so we were excited to give it try. We checked out the menu online and decided on the vegan chicken sandwich ahead of time, as well as the two sides we wanted. Well, when we arrived there was a full on party going on at the bar and what we assume was the manager or owner--dressed in civilian clothes--was drinking with customer while going back and forth between the customers area and behind the bar. And also taking cigarette breaks out front. He appeared to be two sheets to the wind while also trying to half run the bar. There was one lone employee in uniform shuffling back and forth from the back of house and the bar-- barbacking assumedly and half running the bar. We stood at the food counter on the other side, waiting without receiving as much as a nod or eye contact from anyone in the place for a solid three minutes. Staff just kind of acted like we weren't there. Finally the bar-assisting employee bustled by and told us that someone would be with us soon. A few minutes later, another uniformed employee who had been on cleaning duties, hustled over, sweating heavily to take our order. We told him exactly what we wanted and he looked puzzled, asking questions that didn't apply to our order and telling me that it only came with one side. I had to point up at their own menu and show him that was not the case because he was insisting on arguing about it. He seemed perplexed but still would only allow us one side each. We said sure whatever. He continued to fumble through the system for a few more minutes before agreeing that we did indeed get two sides. He was clearly unfamiliar with taking orders or navigating their system. You'd think a basic knowledge of what they serve and what the menu options are should be expected at the very least from anyone working there. We each ordered the vegan chicken sandwich meal w/sauces, fries, and a salad. When we got home and opened our order, we got two vegan PATTY plates: meaning not on a bun, no slaw, and we got no sauce. What was the point of having us choose a sauce?? We checked the receipt and saw the frazzled (yet still sassy and snippy) employee had rung us up for the wrong thing. The best thing about this experience was the salad. It was so so good. We would both definitely come back just to have that salad again. It really sucked hoping to sink our teeth into a vegan chicken sandwich and getting nothing even remotely resembling that. Then we couldn't call or go back to get it fixed because they had already closed for the night.

They should restore online ordering for this location in their website. There's a price mark up using door dash and others. Don't understand why this is the only location without online ordering thru the site. 
Food is good if you have time to wait.
Great live music and chill ambiance with great chicken options! They have a lot of variety for chicken, would definitely recommend!

OMG!

OMG!

OMG!

First things first, Ponko Chicken is located on West Peachtree sandwiched between 8th St and Peachtree Pl.

I normally get a Spicy Ponko Chicken Plate with Rice and Pickles. Extra Spicy Sauce Required. 

Ponko Rice (Sticky Rice) 
Ponko Pickles (Marinated)

To note: Spicy at Ponko doesn't mean hot. It just means spicy. Some flavor, mild heat. 

The cakecups are pretty decent. 

If you're wondering if I'll be back? The answer is YES! I've been known to frequent this location...lol

the chicken, rice, and fries are all cooked well and delicious. the location is very accessible if you live in midtown, as it is walkable.

the food is a bit expensive but not outrageous. the shop was clean and nice and the customer service was good. not anything to write home about, but certainly no complaints. 

parking would be a bit more tricky as there is some street parking nearby and parking garages; however, it is on peachtree.

Super delicious!!
No salt, always fresh!!
Take or dine in is good!!
Always stop here!

Tried their midtown location which was bustling for taco Tuesday (2.50$ tacos) we tried both the chicken and tofu tacos and we definitely thought the tofu was flavored better. Not bad for a slow evening with friends. They also have Trivia but was loud so sat in their covered patio
Food is always on point! Very convenient location. Service has always been great for me. Ambiance is very low key and chill which I love, just grab food and go. No crowds.

This is one of my favorite chicken places, but it's absolutely miserable inside in the evenings. The music is so loud, you can't hear anything. When I got out to eat with friends I want to hear them, not scream at them across the table. They're trying to make it into a club or something, I don't get it, it's a restaurant.... It ruined the experience for me, I won't be dining there anymore

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the 5 star review!!!

comment.text:
Introduced by my girlfriend, I was skeptical that a chain can do an Asian style chicken tender right; but my OH my was I blown away by not only how crispy, juicy, sweet it was, but that it was just a convenient meal right in my backyard. I've omitted it for years and suddenly I was blow away. You can get the chicken tenders regular or spicy. I recommend spicy, which is not even that spicy. It just has a bit more flavor to it than the regular. It's so delicious with the ranch. They also have this sweet soy sauce on the side that i like to add on top.

Secondly, the fries. Crisp. Ask for nothing more. Crispy and lightly salted. All topped with a creamy ranch that goes perfectly with both items. YOU CANNOT FORGET THE RANCH. Sometimes they provide it, BUT SOMETIMES YOU NEED TO ASK. ALWAYS ASK FOR THE RANCH. I usually order "The Basic" which is three tenders with a side of fries or rice. Fries all the way for me, but I know my girlfriend enjoys the rice, especially if you pour the brown soy sauce mix that they have. Great times.

Will be back, I guarantee it. They also have multiple locations within the Atlanta area, so there are options! A few other locations that I know of: Lennox Mall, Chamblee, Marietta Square.

Parking at this location is a bit tricky. They do have paid street parking right in front of the building, or you can park in the parking deck nearby and ask the cashier to validate your ticket for you.

photos.caption: The Basic - spicy tenders and rice
The Basic - spicy tenders and fries

comment.text:
Im a bit biased since I've only been here on taco Tuesday but I do love this place. The chicken really is delicious, and the tacos are priced well. 

A little hesitant to try the rest of their menu given the cost, but the tacos are definitely a steal on Tuesday's. 

They have trivia on Tuesday's here too, what's not to hate?!
This always feeds my heart and soul when I go! Loved the flavors but can upset my stomach sometimes
I've order food from a here several times. The chicken is always fresh and crispy. Did I mention how tasty the OG sauce is !

True definition of fusion. I ordered the 3pc chicken meal with OG sauce and a side of fries. It was so good I went twice during my Memorial day weekend trip to Atlanta. Wish this were here in Florida!

came again on a thursday night. i ordered the ponko plate this time with the original chicken, spicy chicken, and then the fries and slaw.

so many fries! i was stuffed. slaw was okay, much smaller portion. i don't know if it was because the chicken was in a bowl but the sauce/oil collected at the bottom and my chicken was a little soggy :( i've come to ponko several times and it's usually much crispier. also, my friend got the potato salad and said it lacked flavor and tasted like pretty much nothing so she didn't finish it.

also, to note--when i came on a thursday night there was like a DJ playing VERY loud music. there's a bar area which i get but i was sitting with my friend in the corner of the dining area and the music was so loud that we were having to yell to converse and eventually just gave up. it seemed like no one was listening to the music anyways so i'd recommend lowering the volume a bit.

photos.caption: PONKO Chicken Plate PONKO Fries Cole Slaw Potato Salad
PONKO Chicken Plate  PONKO Fries Cole Slaw

comment.text:
Delicious chicken and super fast service!
My friend and I came for lunch and we loved the food. We both ordered the 3 piece Spicy Ponko Chicken Plate with Fries and Rice. The portion sizes were huge and could've definitely been 2 meals for me. The chicken was freshly fried and very flavorful. I also really liked the OG sauce that came with the rice. The fries were also very tasty and perfectly seasoned. There was also a bar that we didn't get to try, but we definitely will be back to try some cocktails!
The staff was also very friendly and we got our food fast. This is a great spot for lunch or dinner, and the newer brunch menu looks great as well!

Another gem on the tacos and tequila bar crawl. This place was unique in that they offered ponko chicken or what I believe was panko crusted chicken. What impressed me the most was one of the workers... he was so enthusiastic and talked up the business. He was the main reason we tried the food.

They only offered two taco selections as well...ponko chicken and tofu. I got the chicken and it was delicious! Cooked hot and fresh and it did not disappoint. We had a matcha margarita which was okay. It wasn't my cup of tea but the service in itself was great. Going to go back and try the chicken tenders and rice!

Have always been a fan of Ponko since Day 1 and am never disappointed! Went on a Saturday morning for their brunch and got the Chicken & Waffles with OG sauce for my chicken. Very yummy. 

Their $3 mimosas offered during brunch are also a steal!

This spot is great just like the other location I've been too. They have a good space for covered outdoors seating in front too. You order your food then they give you a number and will bring it to your table. 
I like to get the chicken tenders. This time with spicy sauce but also the OG sauce and bbq sauces are good too. All of the sides are tasty as well. The French fries are extra krispy and the rice is extra good texture.

photos.caption: Ponko Chicken with Ponko Fries and Ponko Rice

comment.text:
If you have not tried Ponko Chicken, you are missing out! This restaurant serves Japanese style fried chicken tenders and won Taste of Atlanta for the last two years. Also, Wine Wednesday specials! And then starting October 9th @ponkomidtown will have trivia!
FRIED CHICKEN + WINE SPECIAL$ + TRIVIA = Happy Wine Wednesday!!

AntlantaEats Ep. 62

Japanese themed spot, I gotta say their Tenders are delicious hands down. No complaints. I ordered 3 flavors: The Original, Spicy, and the BBQ (My fav outta the 3). Very quality eats.

The drink they made me ummmm...put me in a different zone. Thank god I wasn't driving 

Here's my experience: https://www.instagram.com/p/CMp7l0Vg3iA/?igshid=s7vf81ikgukl

Visited the great establishment on a taco crawl. All the staff was friendly and accommodating. I believe I got a spicy chicken taco, and after one taco I was stuffed.

We also had margaritas, and the bartender was awesome and the drink was just the right portions of alcohol vs mixers. Actually, all of the fun and action was happening at the bar. I'll definitely return again!

What is this place? AMAZING! Unique, perfectly executed menu, specializing in Korean chicken (katzu like) with some simple, but good sides. Hot dog katsu style??? YEP! DELICIOUS! Tofu tacos, you guessed it, out of this world! Live DJ people dancing in line to order, full bar... this is the most unique place I've ever been. Come here for a great experience, people watching, music, open air patio, GREAT food!

The food is still delicious , but they have a server when you're cashing out named Wesley & he is RUDE as can be. Last Tuesday I watched him try & fight a customer who grabbed her to go order off of the counter. The lady said something back to him & Wesley yells at the woman don't you get sassy with me.m, then he shouts a few more phrases while the lady was exciting the establishment. 

Today we called in our order & low n behold Wesley answers the phone, let's just say the rudeness immediately started. I mean he's just pure bad customer service. Just straight testy. The past few years we've always had good customer service until these last two visits with Wesley. Hell he got testy with another lady who tried to reach for her to go order & the lady freaks out like I'm sorry I don't know your process. 

Hopefully it gets fixed. Maybe he's overwhelmed, but it's not good for business.

photos.caption: Such a tasty Ponko Chicken Plate
My go to meal Ponko Chicken Plate is
Ponko Chicken Plate is my fav
Ponko Chicken Salad . Make it spicy

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Jeremy, pls email me when a free moment as I would like to hear more about your experience as we take this very serious......................Thank you Johnny

johnny@ponkochicken.com

comment.text:
I am a huge Ponko Chicken fan.  This location is on West Peachtree Street and has a full bar as well as patio.  The setup is quick service where you order at the counter and get a number.  

I used to dine in frequently, but have been doing carryout ever since the pandemic started and they have carryout down to a science.  I recommend you order ahead on ChowNow -- the prices are lower than UberEats, GrubHub, etc and they even have their own Ponko Chicken App through ChowNow.

While they have a fairly complete menu, this place is a chicken finger joint at its core.  Their breading is pretty unique -- they call it "Japanese-American" a description that's fair since it is hybrid of what you would find in Japan in a Tonkatsu dish and something that is more familiar in the US.  It's really tasty.  

I normally get the chicken finger plate spicy (you have the choice of spicy, bbq or OG -- their sweet sauce) with brown rice and a side salad.  I'm a big fan of their walnut cilantro salad dressing and they also have homemade ranch that I use on my chicken that is delicious. 

Locations are popping up around Atlanta -- check them out, I give them my highest recommendation.

photos.caption: Spicy PONKO Chicken, Brown Rice, Side Salad with Walnut Cilantro Dressing

comment.text:
The Taco Tuesday is such a great deal! $2 chicken tacos with choice of original, spicy, or bbq sauce. The tacos come with a chicken tender and some slaw and a jalapeño crema sauce on a flour tortilla. I would say 3 tacos is a good portion for a meal. I love the texture of their chicken tenders because they are crunchy without having too much breading like normal chicken tenders. The OG sauce is my favorite. 

We came during lunch rush and the employees were super efficient and worked through the line but still really nice and polite. Food came out in about 5 minutes. Convenient street parking right out front. They also have a bar...This is a great choice for an inexpensive and quick casual meal in Midtown!
Very good chicken tenders and fries. It's practically cooked to perfection. I also experienced friendly and helpful customer service. The portions are bigger than how they look in the photos.

photos.caption: Chicken tenders, fries, side salad. (Looks bigger in person)

comment.text:
Visited Ponko Chicken with my fraternity brothers during the NBA All Star Weekend (3pt. & Dunk contests). I've been to a different location, but never this one. 

The Service: The service was great. We had a party of nearly 20-30 people, so the servers & bartenders were very patient with us. 

The Parking: Be sure to get your parking validated.

The Atmosphere:  It's a cool little spot. They even had a pianist/singer performing live as people at their meals. Several places to sit and about a 5-6 seat bar. 

The Food: At the other location, I've only tried their chicken tenders. On this day, I wanted something different. Since Chicken sandwiches are pretty popular these days, I wanted to try theirs. The sandwich is topped with Cole slaw & comes with your choice of a side (mine being French fries). WOW! Ponko should drop their hat in the Top Chicken sandwich discussion, because this thing was SOOOOOO GOOD! I honestly wanted another to take home. I think I've found my "go-to" meal moving forward. I can't see myself ordering anything else besides this chicken sandwich. 

I also had one of their cookies. It was pretty good. I'm a soft cookie guy and this one is like a crisp, but it wasn't bad at all.

Overall, I had a great time & enjoyed the food. Not sure I'll be back to this location since it's far from my home, but when I do, I know what I'm eating. Thanks to the staff for being so helpful.

photos.caption: Spicy Ponko Chicken Sándwich w/ Fries ($11)
Spicy Chicken sandwich with Cole slaw

owner_replies.comment: We're so glad to hear that you and your group had a good time. We think our chicken sandwich is one of the best too :)  Thank you so much.

comment.text: The service was very fast here. They had outdoor seating and brought the food out to us. The chicken with OG sauce is really great! The only downside if you sit outside is how loud west peachtree street can get .. our chicken was accompanied with a side of leaf blower.

This looked like just another restaurant on the midtown strip but after hearing my friends rave about it for weeks I had to stop in and try. We got all the Ponko specialties the chicken, rice and fries. It was the most delectable meal I've had for lunch. The fries were seasoned to perfection, and complimented the specialty PONKO chicken very well. The chicken itself was juicy and the crust was crunchy. The rice was Japanese Style, kinda unexpected from a fast food stop but much appreciated. 

Mark, the manager took care of my family and I as we were in town for my graduation. Excellent service and recommendations.

photos.caption: Ponko Chicken , Ponko Fries , Ponko Rice

owner_replies.comment: So glad your experience was enjoyable. Thank you.

comment.text: Ordered the Ponko Chicken to go! The chicken was delicious and not spicy at all. I wasn't a fan of the rice, the fries were good though.

Came to Ponko Chicken for lunch; I had heard good things from others about it so myself and two others decided to try it out at the Midtown location.

Ordering was pretty quick; service was friendly and there's lots of seating so the whole process was pretty painless. I got the spicy 3 pc chicken tender plate with a side salad and rice. I originally wanted the pickles, but when I got there they told me they were all out. This was definitely a bummer; since we came two hours before closing (they closed at 3pm on 12/31) I guess it's not completely surprising but dang! I had been looking forward to those pickles!

My thoughts on the food are that it's just fine; maybe a bit overpriced. The rice (which was recommended to me) was just pretty standard sticky rice - the sauce was intriguing, but I didn't really get much of it. The chicken itself is crispy and decently juicy on the inside which is nice, but the spicy wasn't spicy at all - just a bit more flavorful. It didn't blow my mind or anything; and besides the crisp it didn't stand out any more than chicken from a fast food joint would. I tried my friend's green beans and thought they were just okay too; they are in a miso-tahini sauce and while they didn't taste bad it wasn't something I could eat for a while.

Overall I think this is a clean, friendly spot in Midtown for some fast-casual food but is lacking in flavor and uniqueness for what you're paying.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your review.  Our green beans are in a miso tahini sauce and a customer favorite but are not for everyone. The OG is also a customer favorite. Maybe next time you can try it.

comment.text:
The Eggs Benedict on the weekend brunch menu is amazing!
We also had the rice bowl with the ponko chicken which wasn't that great.
The place has a nice and casual vibe

photos.caption: Originial Ponko chicken plate with fries (must have!), side salad and potato salad (skip)

owner_replies.comment: Love to hear that about our eggs benedict. Brunch is served from 11a-3p Saturday and Sunday. Hope to see you again soon. Thank you.

comment.text:
I have a good/bad relationship with Ponko, and more often it's good than bad.

The midtown location is located only one block from my office, so that I [love]. The service is relatively quick and you can order ahead online -- another [love]. There are some items that are pretty consistently good every single time -- a great [love]. 

The past couple of times I've dined here, I've met a few people here for a quick lunch and on both occasions I've ordered the PONKO Salad with chicken tenders. On the first try, I ordered the OG chicken and the second time, the spicy chicken. At $12 for 5 pieces of chicken on a bed of bagged salad mix and a generous serving of fried crispy wonton strips, I can't say this is a great deal, but it's a decent price to pay for a lunch in Midtown. The OG chicken had a batter that was very, very crispy - almost too hard and crispy, so I enjoyed the coating of the spicy tenders much better. Also, what's up with the ranch? It is very watery.

I've picked up a kids' meal for lunch when I don't want anything too big - it's probably one of the best deals. For $5, you get 2 pc PONKO chicken, rice or fries, carrots, ranch, and a juice box. Instead of the 2 pc PONKO chicken, you can also sub 3 pc tofu tenders or 3 oz of grilled chicken. 

I love their fries here but the rice can be hit or miss. Sometimes the food is packaged well and everything is excellent, and sometimes you're eating a somewhat soggy mess. I think this place has great quality items and once the consistency is better, I'm sure I would really enjoy the place!

owner_replies.comment: Thank  you for your review. Everything is made from scratch and prepared daily. Because the food is cooked to order, our containers are left open so the tenders don't create condensation and become soggy. Unfortunately, this happens. We're always working on improvements. Thank  you for your review.

comment.text: Japanese American fusion, sign me up! I got the Ponko chicken spicy and OG with their fries with foodie flakes and sticky rice platter. I tell you I inhaled it as soon as I got it, and then was left wanting more. The spicy was my fav! Okay, Atlanta. I see you and all your dope Asian food options.

This place is on west Peachtree with not much free parking around. I went here for Lunch Wednesday 1-29-20. I was able to walk to this place for Lunch. This was my first time here. I liked The atmosphere. There are televisions and a bar you can go to. This is a good spot if you want to have a good drink while you're on lunch (don't tell your supervisor.) It wasn't too noisy but it wasnt a quiet place. 

The best part of my visit was the cashier he was so into his job I loved that he was so pleasant and his attitude told everything. He was very detailed was very specific about every item on the menu. I told him this is my first time and asked him what he would recommend. He recommended the three-piece panko meal with two sides so I got that and a big round oatmeal chocolate chip. 

All together it was a little over $12...pretty pricey. I thought this better be some damn good chicken. It wasn't... it was basically breaded chicken tenders and you do get a choice of three different sauces. I got the spicy. It had a hint of sweet but wasn't too sweet. It was decently spicy but not overwhelming. 

u get two sides.  the cashier recommended the French fries And I got green beans. When my food came they gave me rice and green beans. I told the lady nicely I had french fries and green beans she said OK let me look into that. Then another gentleman came out handed me my food and apologized for the mixup. again I got the wrong food. This time I got rice and french fries but they took away the green beans I wanted. . I Was pressed for time since I was on my lunch break and I'm really not hard to please so I didn't even say anything. I just didn't eat the rice and I only ate the french fries and three chicken tenders that came with the meal. 

The cookie was crunchy and decent but not great. 

I will come back and try something else and see if maybe something else strikes my fancy. But for my first visit I wasn't wowed.

photos.caption: Three pc ponko meal over a bed of rice
Oatmeal chocolate chip cookie. After they delivered the wrong food and took it back I got hungry and broke a piece off. Don't judge me

owner_replies.comment: Sorry for the food mix up. We really do try to get the meal correct and will make sure our employees pay better attention to the orders. Our chicken tenders are breaded in Panko which is a little different than what you get at other restaurants. We hope you come back and perhaps try one of our chicken sandwiches. Thank you.

comment.text:
I give Ponko Chicken's new location in Midtown 3.5 stars rounded down to 3. On Yelp, that means "A-OK." I think it's great Ponko has brought their delicious Japanese-inspired chicken tenders to this part of town. If you've never had them before, they're worth trying.

This is Ponko's second Atlanta-area location and it opened in April 2019 on the ground level of the Nine15 Midtown apartment building, very close to the Midtown MARTA station. Parking in the Nine15 garage is free with two-hour validation from Ponko. Enter the garage via Peachtree Pl NE, in between Babalu and Dancing Goats.

We visited on a Friday night and the place was moderately busy. There was a friendly employee outside the entrance handing out free toothpick samples of chicken to sidewalk passersby.

The scene at this Ponko is different than the original location on Chamblee Tucker Rd. We saw a trendier and more diverse in-town crowd. The atmosphere was way more bar-like with live music, TVs, and open-air patios (one of which is covered and can be fully enclosed). The bar doors shutter-open to the street. Whereas the Chamblee Tucker location is more of a food destination, our experience here resembled more of a local watering hole where people hung out, drank, and enjoyed the music.

The physical restaurant space looks good with a clean, contemporary, and somewhat communal feel. It's spacious with a fast-casual setup -- order at the counter, take a number, and your order is brought to you. This is where it felt kind of weird to me. The atmosphere was like that of a sit-down restaurant (servers brought us food, took away trays and used sauce bottles), but the food was fast food or fast-casual (this business' core product is chicken tenders). I can't put my finger on it, but it felt like a disconnect.

That and a piece of wall art fell off the wall next to the bar, startling everyone in the vicinity. It looked like other pieces of art had fallen off the walls in other places of the restaurant as evidenced by the strips of sticky tape that remained. Just a new-business kink for them to iron out.

Ponko sells salads, sandwiches, tacos, and plates (plates come with two sides), all featuring their local-award-winning Ponko chicken tenders. Expect to spend about $10-12 plus tax and tip for a meal. When it comes to Midtown dining, this is a relatively affordable option. Ponko chicken comes in three flavors: OG (original sweet sauce), spicy, and BBQ. Along with fried tenders, they also offer tofu tenders, vegan patties, grilled chicken, and an all-beef hot dog ($5). Sides include white and brown rice, regular and sweet potato fries, potato salad and coleslaw, pickles, green beans, and salad. I do wish they offered a few more or better variety of side options. For dessert, they offer scratch-baked cookies ($2.50 each) and "cakecups," individual servings of assorted cake flavors in clear plastic cups ($4.50 each).

We got a couple plates: (1) Ponko chicken OG 3-piece ($10) with Ponko fries and Ponko pickles and (2) Ponko chicken spicy 3-piece ($10) with Ponko rice and coleslaw plus a red velvet Ponko cakecup ($4.50).

The chicken tenders and cakecup were great, but the sides were underwhelming. As a whole, I thought the plates (really, they were bowls) could have used an extra side or more ingredients. They didn't seem "well-rounded" or fully complete to me. Some of the side portions were too small (pickles, slaw). I was hoping the plates would be more filling.

When it comes to flavor, based on my experience here and at the Chamblee Tucker location, I recommend the OG (original) flavor. I like it the best. It's terrific. They've got the breading and seasoning just right. Slightly crispy, a little sweet, and tender, quality meat. The spicy isn't bad. As someone who loves spicy food, it's just not hot enough for me. It does have a bit of acidity/tanginess to it.

Ponko fries come with "Foodie-Flakes." I don't know what that is, but it looked like dried seaweed to me. Ponko fries have that extra crunch and airiness to them, similar to the sesame fries served by Korean taco joints. Ponko rice is white sticky rice with some of Ponko's OG sauce (sweet) squirted in plus Ponko pickles on top. It's basic. Ponko's OG sauce tastes like it has mirin (sweet and tangy Japanese rice wine) in it, but I could be wrong.

The pickles (cucumbers) were yummy. I just wish there were more of them. They were cold, crisp, and refreshing. Lightly pickled. The slaw was par for the course. I don't really recommend it.

If I recall correctly, there were about three or so cakecup flavors. Admittedly, Ponko's cakecups are somewhat gimmicky, but the flavor is there. The red velvet cakecup we got was fantastic. It tasted freshly-made. The cake was delectably moist and there were two layers of luscious cream. My only gripe is at $4.50, they're pricey for what you get.

Service was good. There was plenty of staff the night we went, several eager to serve.

I'd come back.

photos.caption: Outside. They have a covered and enclosed patio.
Free parking with validation in the Nine15 Midtown apartment deck. Enter via Peachtree Pl NE in between Babalu and Dancing Goats.

They've been open for two weeks now. New location in Midtown Atlanta.

Inside. Bar area facing entrance, stage, and additional dining space.
3-piece Ponko chicken plate (spicy flavor) with Ponko rice (white sticky rice), Ponko pickles, and coleslaw (sweet sesame). $9.
3-piece Ponko chicken plate (spicy flavor) with Ponko rice (white sticky rice), Ponko pickles, and another side. $9.
3-piece Ponko chicken plate (spicy flavor) with Ponko rice (white sticky rice), Ponko pickles, and another side. $9.
3-piece Ponko chicken plate (OG flavor) with Ponko fries ("Foodie-Flakes") and Japanese-marinated Ponko pickles. $9.

owner_replies.comment: Thanks for the feedback, Daniel! We're glad you enjoyed our new space! If you prefer to have a full-service experience you can sit in the bar area. Otherwise, we do provide a fast-casual experience in the modern vibe that this midtown location has! We think it's the perfect place for our guests to enjoy live music on Fridays and Saturdays and some trivia nights on Thursdays. Hope you'll join us one of those nights!

comment.text:
A cute upbeat place located in midtown. Came on a Wednesday evening. They were playing some kind of trivia which made it a bit loud but it was a cool interactive experience. 

You order at the counter and service was a bit slow to order but they were very friendly when we finally did. They give you a number and then bring the food to you. 

We split a 5pc OG. The sauce is sweet and delicious. The chicken fingers aren't heavily breaded which I loved bc you can actually taste the chicken. Their sticky rice is actual sticky rice and they put homemade pickles on it. Now I'm not really a pickle fan but those pickles were amazing. It also came with a side salad. We opted for their house dressing which was a good choice. It was light and gingery. 

Other than how loud the trivia night was the experience was pretty good. I'd come definitely come back if in the area again and I'd recommend this place.

photos.caption: Ponko Chicken Plate 5pc with an extra order of rice.

owner_replies.comment: Glad you enjoyed yourself. Trivia can get a little loud...sorry about that.
